title: US Imposes Unprecedented Sanctions on Four ICC Judges and Prosecutors
summary: United States sanctions International Criminal Court personnel including judges Kimberly Prost (Canada) and Nicolas Guillou (France), plus deputy p...
description: United States sanctions International Criminal Court personnel including judges Kimberly Prost (Canada) and Nicolas Guillou (France), plus deputy prosecutors Nazhat Shameem Khan (Fiji) and Mame Mandiaye Niang (Senegal). Secretary Rubio calls ICC "a national security threat" and "instrument for lawfare against the United States and our close ally Israel."

sources.title: US sanctions on ICC personnel announcement
ICC denounces flagrant attack against independence
UN spokesman calls sanctions threat to judicial independence

notes: This represents an unprecedented attack on international judicial independence. The US is sanctioning judges from allied nations (Canada, France) for doing their jobs. The ICC's jurisdiction over war crimes is being treated as a "national security threat" simply because it might investigate US or Israeli actions. This fundamentally undermines the post-WWII international legal order and signals that the US will punish any international institution that attempts to hold it accountable. The sanctions effectively tell the world that international law only applies to America's enemies, not to America or its allies.
